topic.title: Removing Compute Nodes
topic.shortdesc: You can remove a compute node from the pool of available resources.

section.p: You may need to remove a compute node in order to replace a failed host, or to change the configuration of a host. If the host is active, you can migrate instances on it by locking the host.

note.p: Before locking a host, ensure that sufficient resources are available on other hosts to migrate any running instances.

li.p: Lock the host to be removed.
Open the Hosts list by clicking Inventory on the System Panel section of the Admin menu, and then selecting the Hosts tab.
Click More Lock Host for the host.
Wait for the procedure to be completed.
Delete the host from the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade system.
Click More Delete Host for the host.
Power down the host and remove the hardware from the cluster.
